sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"陡峭的，险峻的"之意。
means: steep ： 指坡度向上逐渐增加的斜陡坡，强调险峻，暗示难于攀登。
abrupt ： 着重指地形突然起伏，形成尖角状。
sheer ： 指自始至终近于垂直的陡峭，不仅仅很难爬上去，甚至于不可能攀登。

sentence.Network_en: She started once again on the steep upward climb.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又开始沿着陡峭的山路往上爬。

sentence.Network_en: Both he and the crew are on a steep learning curve.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和组员们都学得很快。

sentence.Network_en: San Francisco is built on 40 hills and some are very steep.
sentence.Network_cn: 旧金山建在40座小山丘上，其中一些非常陡峭。

【陡坡路面（steep hill）（Steep hill）】 指陡急的坡面。普通人步行都很难攀登上去的陡坡，在障碍检验赛中却要车手驾车一跃而上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stēap 'extending to a great height', of West Germanic origin; related to steeple and stoop
Middle English: of Germanic origin; related to stoup

entry.def: A steep slope rises at a very sharp angle and is difficult to go up.

example.ex: San Francisco is built on 40 hills and some are very steep.
example.tran: 旧金山建在 40 座小山丘上，其中一些非常陡峭。
两旁山坡陡峭的狭窄山谷

entry.tran: (增加或减少)急剧的，大幅度的
entry.def: A steep increase or decrease in something is a very big increase or decrease.

example.ex: Consumers are rebelling at steep price increases.
example.tran: 消费者在抗议物价飞涨。

entry.def: If you say that the price of something is steep, you mean that it is expensive.

example.ex: The annual premium can be a little steep, but will be well worth it if your dog is injured.
example.tran: 每年要交的保险费可能有点高，但如果你的狗受了伤就会很值了。

entry.def: To steep food in a liquid means to put the food in the liquid for some time so that the food gets flavour from the liquid.

example.ex: It's a drink made by steeping pineapple rind in water.
example.tran: 这是用菠萝皮泡在水里做的饮料。
在橄榄油里浸泡过的青豆

means.word_mean: 1. a steep place (as on a hill)
2. let sit in a liquid to extract a flavor or to cleanse;
2. greatly exceeding bounds of reason or moderation;
3. of a slope; set at a high angle;

auth_sentence.content: It was always going to be a steep mountain.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was always going to be a steep mountain.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was always going to be a steep mountain.

auth_sentence.content: The price for exiting from the fund is steep.
auth_sentence.res_content: The price for exiting from the fund is steep.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The price for exiting from the fund is steep.

auth_sentence.content: The path ahead will be steep and sometimes pitted.
auth_sentence.res_content: The path ahead will be steep and sometimes pitted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The path ahead will be steep and sometimes pitted.

Sentence.sentence: The damage to American craftsmanship seems to parallel the steep slide in manufacturing employment.
Though the decline started in the 1970s, it became much steeper beginning in 2000.
Not surprisingly, the costs are steep.

means.word_mean: 陡的, 急剧升降的, 斜坡、 陡峭的,山等

sentences.en: A car is climbing the steep hill slowly.
sentences.cn: 一辆汽车正在陡峭的山坡上缓缓爬行。

sentences.en: The slope is too steep for us to climb.
sentences.cn: 这斜坡太陡, 我们爬不上去。

means.word_mean: 〈非正〉(要求或价格)过分; 过高

sentences.en: There was a steep rise in prices.
It's a bit steep that I should pay for all of you!
sentences.cn: 要我为你们大家付账, 有点太过分了。

jushi.english: There was a steep rise in prices.
A car is climbing the steep hill slowly.
jushi.chinese: 一辆汽车正在陡峭的山坡上缓缓爬行。

jushi.english: The slope is too steep for us to climb.
jushi.chinese: 这斜坡太陡,我们爬不上去。
